text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with my entry in the craft cooking
video challenge this is speedy chicken
stir-fry i like to call it
crafty chicken stir-fry because I'm
gonna use this craft Asian toasted
sesame dressing as the base for the
sauce for the stir-fry I'm using the
light version they have light and
regular so much faster so much easier
and Asian and sauces can be really
tricky and time-consuming a lot of
different ingredients this takes care of
all that so 1/2 a cup of our craft Asian
toasted sesame dressing for the other
ingredients we're gonna use some garlic
you can use 1/4 teaspoon of powder or a
clove of fresh 2 tablespoons of soy
sauce some ginger quarter teaspoon of
powder or if you want you can use a half
a teaspoon of fresh I'm gonna put in a
quarter teaspoon of red chili flakes
crushed red pepper for some heat so give
that a stir we're gonna use that later
we're gonna cut up some broccoli florets
just the tops about two cups and you
know how the chefs say save the bottoms
to make soup
they never make soup we're also gonna
prep some dry roasted peanuts planners
dry roasted peanuts the crunchiest
peanut ever which is really important in
this chopped up about a third of a cup
make sure you chopped more than you need
because you know some don't make it if
you like cashew chicken here's a tip use
cashews see I taught you an extra recipe
the chicken you're gonna need about a
pound I got three breasts here's just
over a pound slice it nice and thin
consistently size that way it cooks
evenly
our noodles are going to be angel hair
pasta I got 8 ounces that's half a 1
pound package you know if I didn't go to
culinary school I think it would have
been a mathematician
alright so you're gonna salt some water
bring it to a boil and cook the angel
hair for 3 minutes throw in your
broccoli and cook it for another couple
minutes see it takes about 5 minutes all
together we're gonna drain that and get
on to our chicken
alright so dump your chicken into a hot
nonstick saute pan just a little bit of
vegetable oil and we're gonna stir fry
that for about 6 or 7 minutes now stir
frying has two key elements the stirring
and the frying all right so stir and fry
for about six or seven minutes then
you're gonna dump in your craft toasted
sesame dressing you're gonna dump in
that soy ginger garlic mixture
and just simmer that altogether for
another minute and you are done takes
about eight minutes altogether alright
so what you're gonna do is you're gonna
put that on a plate that's gonna make
for nice portions so divide up your
pasta gonna divide up your broccoli
you're gonna spoon that delicious
chicken over the top drizzle some of the
sauce you're gonna top it with those
planters crunchy dry roasted peanuts
that is a magnificent chicken stir-fry
it was that easier one by the way you
